SEARCH
Package roles

Class BaseRole

java.lang.Object
roles.BaseRole
Direct Known Subclasses:
Manager, Tester
public abstract class BaseRole extends Object
BaseRole abstract class serving as the foundation for all role-based menu systems. Demonstrates abstraction by defining common behavior and requiring subclasses to implement role-specific functionality. This class showcases polymorphism through method overriding in subclasses.
Version:
1.0
Author:
CMPE-343 Project Group

    • BaseRole

  • Method Details

    • showMenu

      public abstract void showMenu()
      Abstract method that must be implemented by each role to display their menu. This demonstrates abstraction - each role will have its own implementation.

    • getRoleName

      protected abstract String getRoleName()
      Abstract method to get the role name for display purposes.
      Returns:
      The role name

    • displayMenuOptions

      protected abstract void displayMenuOptions()
      Abstract method that defines the available menu options for each role. This demonstrates polymorphism - each role overrides this with their specific options.

    • handleMenuChoice

      protected abstract void handleMenuChoice(String choice)
      Abstract method to handle menu selection for each role. Each role implements their own menu handling logic.
      Parameters:
      choice - The user's menu choice

    • displayMenuHeader

      protected void displayMenuHeader()
      Displays the common menu header with user information. This is a shared method available to all roles.

    • displayMenuFooter

      protected void displayMenuFooter()
      Displays the common menu footer.

    • getMenuChoice

      protected String getMenuChoice()
      Prompts the user for menu choice input.
      Returns:
      The user's choice as a string

    • changePassword

      protected void changePassword()
      Handles the change password functionality common to all roles. Demonstrates encapsulation - password logic is hidden within this method.

    • logout

      protected void logout()
      Handles the logout functionality common to all roles.

    • pauseScreen

      protected void pauseScreen()
      Pauses the screen until user presses Enter.

    • isValidInteger

      protected boolean isValidInteger(String input)
      Validates if input is a valid integer.
      Parameters:
      input - The input string to validate
      Returns:
      true if valid integer, false otherwise
